Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility does
not fall under the ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is not contracted, so DHS Contract/Policy requirements are
not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance. in the following areas
 It was suggested that the facility add additional information to the transporters
log. This additional information should provide detail about the purpose of the
need to transport the resident rather than just identifying that the resident had
an appointment. The facility was in agreement with this suggestion and will
begin adding this information to the log.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this review
period. The last corrective action plan submitted by the facility was in regard to their
6/29/2018 Renewal inspection. This involved a CAP that was approved on 7/5/2018.
Eleven restraint reports were reviewed and in all, it is documented that the staff
followed the facility procedure for restraints. Fifteen seclusion reports were reviewed
and as with the restraint report, it is documented that the staff followed the facility
procedures for seclusions.
Numerous staff were interviewed, and this included administration staff to direct care
staff. All staff indicated a desire to use best practice when providing treatment to the
residents in care. The direct care staff indicated that he believed the administration
was open to listening to their concerns and also providing the best care for residents.
All staff interviewed understood the changes that were put into place for COVID-19
4

and all were able to show how they are taking safety measures. The residents
interviewed all shared a belief that the staff are focused on providing care and all
indicated feeling safe at the facility.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
